4LnxHanLuN79JwpxBij83Q.text: Where once there was Paul's Original Sandwich House (P.O.S.H), now there is Tani Modi, a little Italian deli. Their speciality is piadas, which are the Italian take on the wrap. Fillings are really impressive, with the soft cheese, prosciutto and rocket one that I tried proving to be mighty tasty. Their soup is very good, too.  Overall, we said: "I was really impressed with Tani Modi. It starts its journey at a really high quality level, so I'm optimistic that it can develop into a real favourite. It has some competition, nearby, but I think it's offering something a little different, so has a good chance to carve out its niche. I'd happily recommend it to you, as a great lunchtime stop."

Shyxh4cDhNzgmQiNdIvZOw.text: Great food at this quaint little restaurant. My wife and son have a variety of food aversions and the staff was very helpful in accommodating. Actually the menu itself was fairly easy to find something that worked. But besides allergy awareness the food, staff, and location are just wonderful. We really enjoyed eating here while on vacation.

oCXc2z-N757gzQ1bKYECAA.text: Gorgeous apple and cinnamon pancakes, huge portion, struggled to finish but it was so delicious I had to. Menu is good as are prices. One gripe- the breakfast tea they serve isn't good at all. Very weak and tasteless.

8wIUiaNiRsc_Hf9LNhMxxg.text: Cozy breakfast on the way to the train station. Good service and food was well done. Thy have a nice selection of deserts for the sweettooth. The much menu looked great. I was really disappointed I couldn't try a sandwich as the Italian sandwiches sounded good. So would I go back, yes! Service was very good for a very busy weekend morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

-YMZQUJPhyCfj9T5LYjZeQ.text: Listen to me. Just listen.  This place. I'm sorry, I can't even finish that sentence. This place is un-freakin-real.   Bacon on top of pancakes with peanut butter whisky sauce. It's likeeeeeeeee. Indescribable. First off - the bacon is not comparable to American bacon. Forget it. American bacon is not even regurgitated table scraps compared to this. And the PEANUT BUTTER SAUCE. Adds another layer of amazingness.   We stopped here and came back the next day desperately trying to get in even with a 40 min wait. Whatever you do, go.

PmE6SQrUOEflr1hCu7Lntw.text: Excellent food and service.  I would highly recommend this place especially for breakfast!

2tRtLRZy8FNwP7XgMWsTkg.text: We ate a portion of full breakfast and blueberry pancakes. It was so fresh and absolutely delicious. The pancakes are a must try! Their gingerbread latte was great as well. Beautiful place. Great interiors. Very cozy and tiny

tTwgtRTKP0Vv1tejHKg83w.text: Needed to find a place close to the train stop for breakfast, and this place seemed cute! It's a bit hard to find, but it's off Hanover St. And it's BELOW a building. So keep an eye out for the signs that says "Downstairs".   Once in, the cafe has about seven tables, we sat all the way in the back. They have a good breakfast menu, omelettes, full breakfasts, pancakes, as well as a lunch menu with sandwiches and paninis.   We had the basil omelette and blueberry pancakes. My friends said their full breakfast was the best they'd had so far in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sandwich fridge
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu wall

KJLpm87D1XqztCkx4a7Ipg.text: Once I came here (this was about 10 months ago) and had the most wonderful, flavourful meatball hero that was simply divine. Sadly, since this trip so many months ago, this has never been replicated.   Tani Modi is a cute little sandwich shop/ cafe famous for its meatball hero. My issue is that this cafe gets busy at lunchtimes and their ability to cope is evident in the quality of the hero received.   I find that at busy times my hero will be sloppy, cheese not entirely melted and overall is executed in a messy way. Go after lunch and you'll see the love and care taken to prepare the sandwich that will be well balanced between the bread, meatball and melted cheese. When done well, this sandwich is delicious.   Coffee is ok, and there are some sweet baked treats to get you through the 3pm slump. They also do breakfasts and salads.   Staff are really friendly, there is free WiFi in the basement and ample seating- though it's usually packed at lunchtime so it might be a struggle to get a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Outside.
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Meatball hero.
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Meatball hero with Italian sausage on the side.

mCt57GLzwIe3nD4lLVE_dA.text: Really well done breakfast, lunch brunch place. Fresh ingredients, cosy environment and friendly service. Very much like your mom pop restaurants.   We ordered a ham & cheese omelette, ham Parma panini, Salami Milano pesto panini and a spinach soup. All four things were lovely.   It's next to Urban Angel, but I believe it's more authentic and no nonsense straight up good food that hits the spot and leaves you feeling healthy and not bloated.   Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

w_-vKTIcwj8UBXX8n3JElw.text: Great breakfast food and cappuccino. Also very nice atmosphere and friendly staff. The whole family enjoyed the food.

pfzC61u9ZRtzkK8atA0g1Q.text: This adorbs little undergound Italian deli saved our lives. The boyfriend was incredibly hangry. I was on the verge of a similar emotional hunger meltdown.  We swerved in; bluebear was too far to walk. We were too far gone. The food is so solid. The staff is super friendly. The ambiance is informal and very italian. The relationship between hungry human and food is very natural. It has an open kitchen, which makes it feel like you're in an Italian household, being forcefed too much delicious food by someone's tenacious nona. Aaaannnddd... there is a ton of gluten free stuff. Their gf cakes are incredible... by any standard. A hidden gem, if I ever saw one.

photos.caption: Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious gluten free carrot cake!!!
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Really epic presentation. Great coffe drinks.
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mozz &amp; Tomato omelette, w/ gluten free toast.

8B4iroYmiiPKvcOQvFF2RA.text: I walked in here for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised by their vegetarian option :) the waitress was sweet and super helpful! I spilled my coffee and she was quick to help and get me a new one. The food was delicious and the coffee was excellent. I recommend you stop in here while exploring the city :)

LhIzOwB5wBqAVXisBzkSng.text: Wonderful service, cozy and friendly. Food great! Great place for a good breakfast. Especially liked the Scottish breakfast and pancakes. Check it out.

ICMlyBlTlHbAvXO4y6pFAQ.text: Stopped by for a late lunch with my mom and it was a pleasant experience! I ordered the peperino and my mom got an omelette and blueberry pancakes! The food was delicious and the place itself was quaint and cute! The waiter was friendly and doubled as the cook. I highly recommend it for both breakfast and lunch.

SqGFqF0HVW-_1fL4CwgDCA.text: Very nice Italiano cafe. Quite and quick service in in the Friday afternoon. Highly recommend Italiano hot chocolate.  btw free WIFI

photos.caption: Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

PRAnHSY7CrFY1z-bAAM_nw.text: Nice little Italian cafe for lunch or a snack, with tasty sandwiches (panini and piada), and authentic espresso / cappuccino, at very affordable prices. Highly recommend!

nwOPGM2fwO17k6bwXvlrhg.text: Have eaten here twice, once for breakfast and once for lunch. Enjoyed it both times. As of today July 2015, the map location on Yelp is incorrect.

photos.caption: Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Have eaten here twice, breakfast &amp; lunch. Very good food.
Photo of Tani Modi - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great place!

p6m_2NP4Pi-aNnvJxmyo9Q.text: This is a great little place for breakfast. We have been eating the full breakfast most mornings and this was by far the best one. My husband said even the coffee is better.

c7A6sd5xHXwwn6OvLFHLYw.text: Our lunch today was delicious! Omelette with pesto, tomato and mozzarella, Nutella pancakes, caprese salad... the list goes on. Service was quick, portions were perfect and the staff were so welcoming. Great spot!

hbxqTTgv5GVBk90rH8B7FQ.text: gah - can't check in because I am a street away, can't check in there because it's underground, and while I am whinging, with a lead roof!  Anyway, my review will stand the test of time and prove that 10mins ago, at 2pm, I bought a panini at Tani Modi. Did you know Tani Modi means Forever?   I really wanted a piada (wrap), but they mainly contained meat, so not for me. Given that am sure the non-meat options of the world far outweight the meat, it would be nice if cafes gave a better balance, but I digress - I don't level that at Tani Modi alone. So, I opted for a panini, as it said the magic word 'artichoke'. I went for a late lunch, so the place was pretty dead by the time I got there, so not sure if there is a lunch time rush that you have to be aware of. The Italian boys behind the counter wouldn't dissuade you, and are perfectly pleasant, service with a smile!  There was a bit of homebaking out, but it didn't appeal too much to me, although I did leave with a curious want for a cupcake. The panini itself was light, the artichoke disappeared with the basil, pepper, cheese and olive tapenade and a decent price. It definitely feels like a handy, if slightly tucked away, lunch time cafe.
